basics.name: Haleigh Schwartz
basics.label: Data Scientist | Healthcare Analyst | Runner
basics.summary: Data scientist with a background in biology and healthcare, dedicated to advancing sustainable healthcare solutions. Skilled in applying critical thinking, creative problem solving, and data analysis to optimize healthcare operations and patient outcomes. Eager to leverage a strong foundation in statistical analysis, machine learning, and application development to make impactful contributions.

work.name: New Heights Clinic, A Professional Non-Profit Corporation
work.summary:
As the clinic expands, I am leading several pivotal initiatives to enhance patient care and operational efficiency, including:
- Conducting in-depth patient data analysis to tailor services to community needs
- Implementing the clinic's first Electronic Medical Record (transitioning from paper charts)
- Analyzing and improving the clinic's processes to provide more efficient and quality patient care

work.name: Main Street Family Medicine, PLLC
work.summary:
In this role, I have spearheaded data-driven initiatives to enhance patient care and operational efficiency. Key projects include:
- Developing automated scripts to analyze healthcare and company financial data
- Building custom applications for our unique business model
- Managing our website
- Launching continuous training initiatives, fostering a growth-oriented team culture

work.name: Main Street Family Medicine, PLLC
work.summary:
I started off at Main Street Family Medicine as a medical assistant, where I regularly:
- Worked as a phlebotomist
- Roomed patients and collected patient histories
- Assisted in procedures
- Initiated and completed various projects around the clinic to improve efficiency and workflow

work.name: Oregon Health & Science University
work.summary:
It was here I discovered my passion for data science. While developing developed many hard skills necessary for neuroscience bench work, I also:
- Learned MATLAB to analyze my research data
- Used Adobe Illustrator to create figures and display my research findings
- Used custom scripts to collect data from my two-photon microscopy experiments

work.name: EvergreenHealth
work.summary: I assisted the Emergency Department CT techs in quicky and efficiently completing critical imaging for patients.

work.name: University of Washington
work.summary: I was asked to write for Grey Matters, an University of Washington undergraduate neuroscience journal. I researched and wrote an article on the neurological basis of the phenomenon of giftedness, which was published in the spring of 2020.

work.name: University of Washington
work.summary:
Through the University of Washington's Neurological Surgery Summer Student Program, I:
- Observed various brain and spine surgeries
- Went on rounds with the Neurosurgery Department at Harborview
- Completed research at the Allen Institute for Brain Science

work.name: Northwest University
work.summary:
In my first research role, I:
- Developed techniques and skills necessary for wet-lab research
- Wrote a manual for analyzing Western Blots
- Helped produce my first publication

work.name: Logan Health
work.summary: I completed a summer internship at KRH where I observed in many different departments ranging from the pathology lab to the NICU to interventional radiology.

volunteer.position: Leaders Save Lives: Blood Drive Host
volunteer.summary: One summer, I assisted the American Red Cross by hosting drives, recruiting donors, and running the check-in desk at drives.

For a semester, I volunteered at Dr. Bim Makinde's clinic, where I prepped rooms for patients and procedures, observed as he worked with patients, and helped with secretarial work. Being apart of Dr. Makinde's private practice exposed me to the business side of medicine and, as a cross country and track runner for my college, taught me a lot about injury prevention and treatment options for athletes.

awards.summary: I was honored by the Cascade Collegiate Conference for having above a 3.5 GPA while competing in cross country my senior year.

awards.title: Honors Award
awards.summary: I earned an honor's award for maintaining a 4.0 GPA my junior year.

awards.title: Junior Academic Award
awards.summary: I was honored for having the highest GPA among my class while I was competing in cross country and track my junior year.

awards.title: Academic All-Conference in Cross Country
awards.summary: I was honored by the Cascade Collegiate Conference for having above a 3.5 GPA while competing in cross country my junior year.

awards.title: Academic All-Conference in Track and Field
awards.summary: I was honored for having above a 3.5 GPA while competing in track and field my sophomore year.

awards.title: Honors Award
awards.summary: I earned an honor's award for maintaining a 4.0 GPA my sophomore year.

awards.title: Academic All-Conference in Cross Country
awards.summary: I was honored for having above a 3.5 GPA while competing in cross country my sophomore year.

awards.title: Honors Award
awards.summary: I earned an honor's award for maintaining a 4.0 GPA my freshman year.

awards.title: PURE Scholar
awards.summary: I was accepted into Dr. Delgado's lab as a PURE (Pathway for Undergraduate Research Excellence).

awards.title: Presidential Scholar
awards.summary: I won Northwest University's Presidential Scholarship Competition during my senior year of high school, which granted me a full-tuition scholarship for eight consecutive semesters at Northwest.
